metadata.Title: CVE-2021-20255 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: A stack overflow via an infinite recursion vulnerability was found in the eepro100 i8255x device emulator of QEMU. This issue occurs while processing controller commands due to a DMA reentry issue. This flaw allows a guest user or process to consume CPU cycles or crash the QEMU process on the host, resulting in a denial of service. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Sergej Schumilo, Cornelius Aschermann, Simon Werner

notes.Note: mdeslaur> as of 2022-01-05, proposed patch has not been commited upstream

criterions.comment: qemu package in hirsute is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2022-01-05').
